alert.note: Alert for Clark (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 12:59PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Clark County through 130 PM CDT... At 1258 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Prescott, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gurdon... Whelen Springs... Beirne... Burtsell... Curtis... Vaden... This includes Interstate 30 between mile markers 53 and 67. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for southwestern Arkansas.
